Articles.Content: Why does an update need a name? Did any others have a name?
Why not? It's a bit of harmless fun and will make versions more memorable.

Why not? It's a bit of harmless fun and will make versions more memorable.

Its just weird to me. I was curious as to why.

Kerbal Space Program: 64 bit

Yes. Really. That outshone anything contracts related by far for me.

(And whackjob, I thought you would feel the same way too?!)

64 bit is only truly crucial to those that use very many mods. Currently I'm running commando. Sans mods. It doesn't affect me at all, but I'm glad it's gonna be there for those that it does.
Kerbal Space Program: Start of the 64bit space age

Why does an update need a name? Did any others have a name?

There's no question the response to Asteroid Redirect Mission (0.23.5) was amazing and our team feels like it was the biggest update we've ever done.

I believe the last update had a name But, it doesn't REALLY need one. It's not like NASA played a part in it......or did they?

Why does an update need a name? Did any others have a name?

6 updates from now, will you still remember that SLS parts came out in 0.23.5? Will you remember that they came out in the Asteroid Redirect Mission update? I know which one I'll remember.

Is it critically important? No. Is it "weird"? Not at all. Is it fun and engaging? Yes.

Done.

Kerbal Space Program: Boom or Bust.

Why does an update need a name? Did any others have a name?

0.23.5 was named Asteroid Redirect Mission.
The Schroedinger Paradox.

Haven't read all 11 pages, so sorry if this came up already: The Serious Business Update

Cheers

6 updates from now, will you still remember that SLS parts came out in 0.23.5? Will you remember that they came out in the Asteroid Redirect Mission update? I know which one I'll remember.

Is it critically important? No. Is it "weird"? Not at all. Is it fun and engaging? Yes.

Just my opinion mate. Don't confuse yours with the truth.

It was called Asteroid Redirect Mission because it was basically a pre-release DLC+ update= not weird.
Kerbal Space Program 0.24 - Mission Control Speaking!
KSP: Space, explosions, or double your money back!

Just my opinion mate. Don't confuse yours with the truth.

It was called Asteroid Redirect Mission because it was basically a pre-release DLC+ update= not weird.

You asked a question. I answered it. No confusion on this end

Hmm, what about..

"Kerbal Space Program .24: Contracts & Many Official New Economics Yeah!"

The end part is an acronym for money.

I went with a Star Trek reference:

Kerbal Space Program: Enterprise(ing)
KSP: Try to Grow Up :/
Kerbal Space Program: "We gold them there was a warranty! (LOL)"
0.24: Jeb Gets a Job

0.24: Jeb Gets a Job

Thrillmaster is a perfectly acceptable job title.
0.24: trying not to go bankrupt
We need to make a list of all these.
0.24: Failure is most definitely an option.

Counting Space Beans

Bean Counters Rule Space

Jeb and the Beanstalk.
